head.title: Confrontation in the Gulf; Jesse Jackson Visits Jordan On Way to Meet Iraqi Chief

hedline.hl1: Confrontation in the Gulf; Jesse Jackson Visits Jordan On Way to Meet Iraqi Chief

block.p: LEAD: The Rev. Jesse Jackson arrived in Jordan today on his way to Iraq to meet President Saddam Hussein.
LEAD: The Rev. Jesse Jackson arrived in Jordan today on his way to Iraq to meet President Saddam Hussein.
The Rev. Jesse Jackson arrived in Jordan today on his way to Iraq to meet President Saddam Hussein.
''We hope we will not see a situation where the price of oil will go up and the price of blood will go down,'' he told Jordanian television at the airport.

He said he planned to meet President Hussein and American and other Westerners being held at military and civilian installations in Iraq as human shields against any attack by American-led forces. Mr. Jackson praised Persian Gulf peace efforts by King Hussein of Jordan.
Mr. Jackson is ostensibly going to Iraq as a journalist but said he hoped his interview with President Hussein would contribute to peace.

''We hope that in the course of the interview, some of his answers will have an impact that will help to enlighten people in the world and will make some contribution to expanding hope and to avert a possible disastrous war,'' Mr. Jackson said.
